name: Amur Leopard
description: The Amur leopard is critically endangered due to habitat loss and poaching.

name: Javan Rhino
description: The Javan Rhino is one of the rarest rhinos with only a few left in Ujung Kulon National Park.

name: Vaquita
description: The vaquita is the world's rarest marine mammal and is on the edge of extinction.

name: Mountain Gorilla
description: Mountain gorillas are found in forested mountains and are threatened by habitat destruction.

name: Asian Elephant
habitat: Tropical forests - South and Southeast Asia
description: The Asian elephant is endangered due to habitat loss, degradation, and fragmentation.

name: Snow Leopard
habitat: Mountain ranges - Central and South Asia
description: Snow leopards are elusive big cats threatened by poaching and habitat loss.

name: Giant Panda
description: The giant panda is a conservation icon and mainly threatened by habitat loss.

name: Blue Whale
description: The blue whale is the largest animal ever and is endangered due to past whaling.

name: Sea Otter
description: Sea otters help maintain kelp forest ecosystems and are threatened by oil spills.

name: African Wild Dog
description: These social predators are endangered due to habitat loss and disease.

name: Orangutan
description: Orangutans are critically endangered due to deforestation and illegal pet trade.

name: Saola
description: Also known as the 'Asian Unicorn', the saola is rarely seen and critically endangered.

name: Red Panda
description: Red pandas are threatened by habitat loss and poaching.

name: Hawksbill Turtle
description: Hunted for their beautiful shells, hawksbill turtles are critically endangered.

name: Yangtze Giant Softshell Turtle
habitat: Rivers and lakes - China and Vietnam
description: One of the rarest turtles in the world, with only a few known individuals remaining.

name: Kakapo
description: The kakapo is a flightless parrot that has been brought back from the brink of extinction.

name: Addax
description: The addax is a desert antelope nearly extinct in the wild due to overhunting.

name: Philippine Eagle
description: One of the largest and rarest eagles in the world.

name: Gharial
description: Gharials are fish-eating crocodiles with long narrow snouts.

name: Pygmy Three-Toed Sloth
description: Found only on a single island, this sloth is at risk from habitat disturbance.

name: Axolotl
description: Axolotls are unique amphibians that remain aquatic their whole lives.

name: Northern Bald Ibis
habitat: Semi-arid habitats - Middle East and North Africa
description: An ancient bird once thought extinct in Europe.

name: Sri Lankan Leopard
description: A subspecies of leopard facing threats from habitat loss and poaching.

name: Bonobo
description: Closely related to humans, bonobos are peaceful primates facing severe habitat loss.

name: Irrawaddy Dolphin
habitat: Coastal and freshwater areas - Southeast Asia
description: A dolphin species threatened by fishing and habitat degradation.

name: Bornean Orangutan
description: These great apes are critically endangered due to palm oil deforestation.

name: Western Lowland Gorilla
description: The most widespread gorilla subspecies, still severely threatened by poaching and disease.

name: Scimitar-Horned Oryx
description: This desert antelope now survives only in captivity and reintroduction programs.

name: Andean Cat
description: One of the rarest and least known wild cats in the world.

name: Southern River Terrapin
description: Once thought extinct, this turtle is making a comeback thanks to conservation.
